reviewText: Type-O Negative fans will enjoy this inside look at the band, often in a comical light.  One will also enjoy the videos of their soon to be classic tunes, such as "Black No. 1" and even their most recent, "Everything Dies".  As in past reviews, I wish that the DVD had the option of just viewing the music, but the campy antics of the band on and off stage while on tour is enjoyable to watch.  The videos are "dark" and equally enjoyable. This should top the list of any "Type-O" Fan!
Title: N/A

reviewText: The After Dark DVD does provide some excellent insight into the band and it does include all of their videos up to the time when this DVD was made.  However, I feel like there should have been some more live footage of the band included.  The chatting that occurs between each video is a lot of fun to watch the first time but it gets old with subsequent viewings. Same with the band's commentary.  Instead of being so "chatty", this DVD could have used 30-40 minutes of live... TON music.  One more problem with the disk that might drive you crazy is the fact that there is no chapter selection feature.  If you want to watch just a few of the videos and not all the talking, you have to fast forward to them from the beginning of the disk everytime...I'm giving this one 3 stars only because I like the band so much.  I hope that as they release future DVD's, TON will hire a more competent DVD engineering team.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have this on VHS tape and wanted to get it on DVD, but it's no longer in print so the only ones available are used copies and for a time they were priced way too high for me.  I finally found one more reasonably priced and ordered it so it is now part of my collection.  I saw Type O in concert locally just once.  Great concert.  I'd had knee surgery about a week before so I was still on crutches, but I went anyway.  So glad I did.  While we waited for the doors to open I saw Peter stride across the parking lot to our local Kmart.  If I hadn't been on crutches I would have tagged along from afar just to see the look on people's faces when he walked around the store though it was fun to imagine the reaction he got. RIP Peter... you are missed.
summary: Been looking for this for a while

reviewText: this was a short DVD, but who cares??? ITS TYPE O NEGATIVE! look out for the singer's wife in one of the videos, she is seriously hot. i cant wait for this band to release a new DVD. to me, its been so long since their last one.

reviewText: A must have, although I do have 3 complaints: (1) It needs more songs (2) My dvd menu never worked right, (or I�m and idiot), because every time I select the option to watch the dvd without the commentary (just to see the videos only) it never works and I have to sift through it to see what I want.  (3) The green fuzz is a little over done. Other than this. Great picture, great sound, add this to your collection! (the 3 complaints is why I gave it 4 instead of 5)
